ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Scenario for which responses were provided
How appropriate would it be to help the individual call a family member or friend who can provide assistance?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to connect the individual by telephone to mental health services?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to request a mental health mobile crisis unit to come to the scene?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to voluntarily transport the individual (if they agree to go) for further evaluation (such as to a hospital or crisis receiving center)?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to involuntarily transport the individual (assuming they do not agree to go voluntarily) for further evaluation (such as to a hospital or crisis receiving center)?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to issue a citation?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate

ElementDescription: How appropriate would it be to arrest the individual and transport to jail?
Notes: 0= Not at all appropriate; 5= Very appropriate
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
